TopicTitle: NOPECOPTER: maple seed inspired assymetric helicopter

Articles.Content: maybe i can find a way to make this into an ssto or something... Edited February 6, 2015 by Parallax
That is... life changing! And terrifying

Good lord!

Cupcake...

Waht O.O

That is pure, uncontrolled insanity. I love it.

That may be the most terrifying creation I've ever seen in KSP. It's like someone bolted a sword to a paintshaker and it started flying around!

I love it!
Im sure Kenny would love it, even if he would use it just to taunt Jeb!
That craft is beautifully Pseudo-balanced. You even got the cyclic oscillation of the seed right. Very nice.
Coolest thing I've seen in a long time! Great work!
I have a maple tree in my yard which I planted when I was about five years old... Love this thing.

That may be the most terrifying creation I've ever seen in KSP. It's like someone bolted a sword to a paintshaker and it started flying around!

That is... terrifyingly awesome!

I love it!
I'm not sure which is scarier; the device itself, or that it arrives in a CLOUD OF ITS OWN SMOKE.
That is fantastic, but I can't imagine it'd be a comfortable ride!

Looks amazing! I feel like the 'stupidity' rating on all your Kerbals starts going up from all the shaking of their brains...

Side note: Does anyone else watch youtube videos of KSP and catch themselves trying/wanting to right click and turn the camera to get a better angle?
is that stock? It's awesome.

That is by far the most weirdes working vehicle i have seen so far in KSP. A fine piece of engineering you have there. Kudos to you, Sir!

...Side note: Does anyone else watch youtube videos of KSP and catch themselves trying/wanting to right click and turn the camera to get a better angle?

I sometimes even try that with screenshots... Who cares, if a great game lets one do strange things

speechlessly in awe...

looks like a flying knife, or scissors, or a maple seed. I wonder if anyone has made a real thing like that and lived to tell about it.

actually yes!

this thing was built before WW1, but it didnt work, the craft was a bit underpowered and not sufficiently balanced. then the guys working on it lost funding or something and the project was abandoned.

- - - Updated - - -

just noticed something else too, in the lockheed video they said something about it being unstable at lower rpm's and high angle of attack, i think thats what made mine so unstable as well. it felt much more stable when i was slowly descending/maintaining altitude than when trying to climb as quickly as possible.

Looks amazing! I feel like the 'stupidity' rating on all your Kerbals starts going up from all the shaking of their brains...

Side note: Does anyone else watch youtube videos of KSP and catch themselves trying/wanting to right click and turn the camera to get a better angle?

All the time. It pisses me off when it doesn't work too... before I realize how stupid I'm being.

This thing is quite scary. I was about to yell "Don't do it!!!" just before it approached that low bridge. I wonder if you could further balance it to remove that slight wiggle. This thing reminds me of a ceiling fan in my acupuncturists office. Took me a while to realize it only had one blade.
how do you create a pivot point? or make things spin?

not quite as wobbly this time, just need to keep the rotor speed up, and the blade pitch down and she's good.

how do you create a pivot point? or make things spin?


Infernal Robotics mod Edited January 30, 2015 by Parallax

just noticed something else too, in the lockheed video they said something about it being unstable at lower rpm's and high angle of attack, i think thats what made mine so unstable as well. it felt much more stable when i was slowly descending/maintaining altitude than when trying to climb as quickly as possible.

I'm not sure how well FAR models this, but if you've got any horizontal velocity at all you may be dealing with asymmetric lift due to differences in the relative wind speed over the blade as it goes from the advancing to retreating side relative to your direction of travel. This would be exacerbated by a high AoA, and in extreme case of high forward airspeed and high AoA you might stall the blade when it moves to the retreating side, causing massive vibrations, uncontrolled rolling, and crashing.

Having said all that... what's it's max forward speed?
Holy crud! I didn't think it was possible to make a true helicopter with FAR. I made a variable pitch copter with the stock aero some time ago, but now I'm inspired! Awesome work, Parallax!

WOW, this is just impressive.

I do feel bad for teh pilot, i think riding a external seat on a SRB would be less scary.......

Anyways, the only thing ive seen more impressive then this are pure stock choppers, and those dont exactly work well at all nor are they controllable easily, whereas your design does look like it is both able to fly, and actually fly where you want it to fly.

I almost never say this and mean it, but this time I genuinely do: that is one of the most kerbal things I've ever seen. Insane and dangerous, yet functional and highly efficient (outside of actually using a powered rotor). I like it!
Awesome! I can imagine it took you hours and hours to test and fine tweak the machine before it remotely did what you wanted it to do!
